title: The Great Shopping Reset: How the Pandemic Helped Fix the Retail Industry
sub_head: With less to sell than usual, department stores and specialty chains were able to rein in discounts and charge more, boosting profits
body:
The Covid-19 pandemic was supposed to deliver a knockout punch to department stores and specialty retailers. Instead, many of them are bouncing back healthier.
Profits are exceeding 2019 levels at companies ranging from Macyâ€™s Inc. to Ralph Lauren Corp. Dozens of chains restructured through bankruptcy or worked to shed money-losing locations and now have stronger balance sheets.
